did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle:
Franklin Robert Smith papers,
1875-1919.
did.physdesc: Correspondence, trade cards and other advertising material, and other business and personal papers.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Papers of Franklin Robert Smith, a fruit grower from Ontario County, N.Y., including general accounts, 1883-1906. Also letters, miscellaneous business papers, trade cards and other advertising material.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Fruit grower from Ontario County, N.Y.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Papers of Franklin Robert Smith, including general accounts, 1883-1906. Also letters, miscellaneous business papers, trade cards and other advertising material.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Franklin Robert Smith papers, #2073. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle:
Time sheets (no definite identification - just names and time)
1900-1910
(1909 missing)

Bills of lading; U.S. Express Co. at Hector
1898-1900
; Lehigh Valley R.R. Co. at Hector
1898-1910

Bills of sale (for produce),
1905-1908

Summons to appear at hearing - to Geo. H. Harrold from The People of the State of New York.
July 21, 1875
.

Letter to F.R. Smith, Geneva, N.Y., from A.L. Smith & Son; North Hector, N.Y.
Mar. 22, 1900
, re: price of trays (for packing fruit).

Letter (and form notice) to Nelson C. Smith from Forest, Fish & Game Commission signed J. Annin, Jr., dated
Apr. 10, 1900
, re: granting application and shipment of lake trout fry (for stocking of pond with fish).

Letter to Mr. Smith from T. or F.W. Starr. Dated
Apr. 18, 1900
, re: cost of making disk harrow.

Letter to FRS from A.L. Smith & Son, North Hector, N.Y. Dated
July 16, 1900
, re: order for 10# baskets.

Letter to FRS from Charles Barker, Milford, Del. Dated
July 31, 1900
, re: "New Crop" Crimson Clover seed - sample and price list.

Farm inventory. Dated Hector, N.Y.,
Feb. 25, 1901
. No name on sheet. handwritten in pencil - lists quantity, item and value (includes stock, equipment, feed).

Letter to FRS from William Brooker, Dr. (blacksmithing done). Auburn, N.Y.,
Mar. 18, 1904
. "... delivered blades to Mr. Odell ..."

Letter to Mr. Smith from W.H. Huston, Logan, N.Y.,
Feb. 6, 1905
. "Please pay for posts ..."
Shipping tag - to FRS, Geneva, N.Y., from J.C. Shannon & Son, Penn Yan, N.Y.
Trade card - J.P. Sauer & Co. - Produce Commission Merchants, N.Y.C. Reverse side bears list of dates (no year) and sums of money, but no identification as to transactions.
Four sheets (8 pp.) numbered 45-52 (apparently from advertising pamphlet) re: Columbia disc harrows.
Three account books [one without cover] seems to be General Journals. Dates cover 1883-1906

scopecontent.p:
[Removed from account books and filed with loose MSS.:
1 trade card: R.W. Dixon & Son, New York City
1 letter: to FRS from Baker & Co., Philadelphia, 1903
Also, two receipts for payment of "land army" girls, Sept. 1919]

did.unittitle:
1.
1883-1895
[no cover], expenditures

2.
1896-1899
- sales records

The New York Packer. Vol. 12, no. 37.
Oct. 18, 1913
.

The Rochester Democrat and Chronicle.
Oct. 23, 1913
(incomplete).

5 receipts to F.R. Smith from J.T. Cook, dealer of Hay, Grain, Straw, Flour, Feed, Etc., Geneva, N.Y. to F.R. Smith,
Aug. 8, Oct. 4, Oct. 14, 1905
; and 2 undated.
2 Trade cards:
1. "New Way" hay press manufactured by Sandwich Mfg. Co., Sandwich, Ill.
2. Balliett Bros. pressers of Hay and Straw.
4 letterheads cut from bills:

1. Washington Iron Works, Newburgh, N.Y., dated
Nov. 30, 1868
.

2. New York Central Iron Works, Geneva, N.Y., dated
Oct. 1, 1861
.

3. Eyssenhardt & Becker sole manufacturers of the Belmontyle Oil, Washington, D.C., dated
Jan. 3, 1868
.

4. Willard & Millward, dealers in New and Second-hand Engines, Boilers & Machinery, New York City, dated
Feb. 28, 1868
. [Retained with #571.]

1 Advertisement: How to give the medicated salt Salvet. Guaranteed by the S.R. Feil Co., under The Food and Drugs Act
June 30, 1906
. (2 copies.)
Pamphlet: Pocket Code arranged for the use of Produce Commission Merchants. Published by E.D. Barker, Philadelphia. n.d. 44 pp.
Pamphlet: The Economy Telegraphic Cipher Code. Published by Peycke & Fry, Chicago. n.d. 211 pp.

separatedmaterial.head: SEPARATED MATERIAL
separatedmaterial.p: Map - Adirondacks, 1902. (Four sheets in folder.) Distributed to Maps & Microtexts Dept., July 1974.
